comment: Stupid game. Cost me five euro's, the wooden blocks are excellent for different games.

Yet another example of Moon appropriating El Grande and failing again. Lots of card-trading to build sets... which let you improve your odds at scoring with the "Space Puck". Vaguely interesting card-trading phase, but what it gains you on the board is lame and it is overly long for what it is. Felt like Slapshot's card-trading meets El Grande scoring.

Soulless and unthematic in the extreme. Along with Capitol it is part of Alan Moon's famous "Undead Soulless Cyborg Games" series.
One person of my former game group used to like this game, and I played it probably too much to still have a friendly opinion on this.
Darn, I thought that I would really like this game. Sci-fi mining and trading sounded good to me. It turned out to be dry and non-engaging.
was a suprise to me, has a good fun factor, but not a game that says play it over and over again... I think this is one of alan moons best unfortunally only worth a 6 to me...

From the designer of Ticket to Ride, the only game that uses an ashtray - to great effect, I must say.

I really enjoy this old-school space-themed game of horse trading and hand management, and I wonder why it doesn't have a higher profile. Begging to be modernised and re-released, I reckon.

(The "cosmic ashtray" is used as a cube randomiser.)

Got free from LoBsterCon in May 2022, and donated back in May 2024.

We took forever to try this game. It's been in our library for 5 years. Glad we finally did play. For a 26-year old game, it's pretty solid. Clear play, simple but difficult choices to make, easy scoring. Keeping.

I feel like I always enjoy this game more than everyone else at the table. Very pleasing graphics treatment, and the "ashtray" is quite satisfying. Would like to play again with a new group, maybe lighter gamers.

Wonderful game. I can't get enough of that Cosmic Hockey Puck. I can see how the randomness might be a turn-off, but as an exercise in playing probabilities, I don't see how it's any worse than dice rolls or the dreaded CRT.
Recently played. Excellent game. A must have...
